posts.post_content: This card is turning into an absolute POWERHOUSE in Modern. Aside from the obvious Iona/Unburial Rites combo, finding [Eternal Witness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Witness), [Noxious Revival](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Noxious Revival )  and a two card combo such as [Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker ) / [Splinter Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Splinter Twin )  and  [Pestermite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Pestermite ) / [Deceiver Exarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Deceiver Exarch )  within a 4-colour control shell is pretty scary. Also, this has been integral in powering out T4/5 kills with my  [Heartbeat of Spring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Heartbeat of Spring) deck...

posts.post_content:
This is probably my favorite card in the entire game. It has it all:
  
   
\*It's a tutor.
  
\*It's card advantage.
  
\*It's an instant.
  
\*It takes some amount of thought and deck construction to use properly.
  
\*It has fantastic artwork.
  
   
The deep, lush blues are almost hypnotic, and they set a perfect tone with the sort of cold and pensive expression of the moonfolk pictured. The little bottles she has somehow reminds me of the painting Six Persimmons.
posts.html:

The deep, lush blues are almost hypnotic, and they set a perfect tone with the sort of cold and pensive expression of the moonfolk pictured. The little bottles she has somehow reminds me of the painting Six Persimmons.

posts.post_content:
Gifts Ungiven is probably one of my favorite cards. Simply pick any four cards that do more or less the same thing ([Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God), [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment), [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation), and [Hallowed Burial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hallowed Burial)) or any other impossible-to-split package ([Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker), [Pestermite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestermite), [Reveillark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reveillark), and [Body Double](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Body Double)).  
I absolutely love incredibly modular cards like this!
posts.html:
Gifts Ungiven is probably one of my favorite cards. Simply pick any four cards that do more or less the same thing (Wrath of God, Day of Judgment, Damnation, and Hallowed Burial) or any other impossible-to-split package (Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker, Pestermite, Reveillark, and Body Double).
I absolutely love incredibly modular cards like this!

posts.post_content: I really love this card in my deck. What I always try to get with this card and gives me an automatic win or almost is Voltaic Key, Time Vault, Yawgmoth's Will and Regrowth... my opponents really LOVE me when I get out those at the end of their turn :p If I play otherwise, it's because I already have one of those in my hand. This card is really broken, but in specific decks.

posts.post_content:
@oatusmcflee  
To be fair, someone had a comment that it would make most sense to put depths and hexmage into the graveyard so you have to "work" for the combo. Further, it's worth noting that you're now casting at least two spells and spending 4+ mana, making it easier to counter as well. I can't find the comment at this point, but you get the idea. Sure you get your combo "no matter what" but there are best splits.
